content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron gear wheel production line at position around (16.0, 71.0) to (21.5, 73.5)  
Consists of the following connected entities forming a production chain for iron gear wheels:  
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) extracting iron ore, fueled with coal (6 units), currently working but output blocked due to no sink entity accepting output  
- Stone furnace at position (17.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates, fueled with coal (34 units), currently working but source and output inventories are full  
- Burner inserter at position (17.5, 71.5) moving iron ore from mining drill to furnace, fueled with coal (49 units), waiting due to blocked furnace belt at drop position  
- Burner inserter at position (19.5, 73.5) taking iron gear wheels from assembling machine, fueled with coal (49 units), waiting for source items  
- Burner inserter at position (23.5, 73.5) feeding iron plates into assembling machine, fueled with coal (49 units), waiting for source items  
- Wooden chest at position (18.5, 73.5) collecting iron gear wheels, currently empty  
- Assembling machine 2 at position (21.5, 73.5) set to craft iron gear wheels from iron plates, not receiving electricity and lacking iron plates (needs 2)  
- Small electric poles at positions (21.5, 75.5), (18.5, 72.5), and (18.5, 75.5) providing electricity connections, but assembler still has no power  
- Newly placed steam engine and boiler pair for power generation (positions not specified in logs), intended to energize the factory but assembler remains unpowered  

ERROR TIPS

### Errors related to assembler not receiving power  
- Electric poles are placed and connected, and steam engine and boiler were placed to provide power, yet the assembling machine remains without power.  
- Verify that the steam engine and boiler are correctly connected to the electric poles network that includes the assembler.  
- Confirm that the steam engine is properly fueled and operational to generate electricity.  
- Check that all electric poles form a continuous and energized network covering the assembler and inserters.  
- Ensure no missing connections or gaps in the power grid that prevent power delivery.  

### Errors due to burner inserters running out of fuel and fuel insertion failures  
- Burner inserters initially ran out of coal, causing stoppages. Coal was harvested and inserted into several burner inserters successfully.  
- However, some attempts to insert coal failed due to insufficient coal in inventory at insertion time.  
- Maintain a sufficient coal buffer in inventory before attempting fuel insertion.  
- Automate coal supply to burner inserters or transition to electric inserters once power is stable to avoid fuel starvation.  

### Errors related to offshore pump placement and crafting  
- Attempts to place offshore pump for power generation failed due to no offshore pump in inventory.  
- Crafting offshore pump failed because required sub-ingredients (electronic circuits, copper cables, copper plates) could not be crafted due to missing crafting machines or smelting setups for copper plates.  
- Establish copper plate production line with furnaces and assembling machines to enable crafting of copper cables and electronic circuits.  
- Stockpile or craft offshore pumps before attempting placement to avoid placement errors.  

### Errors related to blocked outputs and full inventories  
- Burner mining drill output remains blocked due to no sink entity accepting its output, causing production halts.  
- Stone furnace source and output inventories are full, indicating downstream bottlenecks.  
- Inserters feeding the furnace and assembling machine are waiting due to blocked belts or lack of source items.  
- Ensure downstream storage or processing entities are available and have capacity to accept items.  
- Clear inventories or expand storage to maintain smooth production flow.  

### General placement and connection error tips  
- Confirm target tiles are free before placing entities to avoid placement failures.  
- Verify assembling machine recipes and power connections before starting production.  
- Use inserters between furnaces and belts rather than connecting belts directly to furnaces to avoid blockages.  

NAMESPACE

No user-defined functions have been defined in the current steps.
